title: How Twitter reacted when Virender Sehwag announced his retirement
text:
Cricket How Twitter reacted when Virender Sehwag announced his retirement Opening batsman Virender Sehwag has announced his retirement from all forms International cricket and Indian Premier League(IPL). The Delhi born right-hander announced his retirement today(Tuesday)through micro-blogging site Twitter. IndiaToday.in | New Delhi, October 20, 2015 | UPDATED 16:44 IST Mail A+ A- Virender Sehwag has announced his retirement from all forms of International cricket. 
Opening batsman Virender Sehwag has announced his retirement from all forms International cricket and Indian Premier League(IPL). The Delhi born right-hander announced his retirement on Tuesday through micro-blogging site Twitter. I hereby retire from all forms of international cricket and from the Indian Premier League. A statement will follow. & Virender Sehwag (@virendersehwag) October 20, 2015 
Sehwag is currently in UAE to sign up for next year's Masters Champions League (MCL), a Dubai based T20 tournament, which involves retired cricketers. 
Yesterday the batsman though rubbished reports of his retirement. When he was asked how he could play as MCL is a retired cricketers' league, Sehwag said "If I am not retired I will not play. I will go back to India and announce my retirement." 
Celebrities and people from the cricket fraternity took to Twitter to share their thoughts on Sehwag's announcement. Here are the tweets Clear thinking n attacking stroke play is been hallmark of ur batting! thank u @virendersehwag for grt memories & wonderful friendship!! zaheer khan (@ImZaheer) October 20, 2015 Will miss you on the field yaar @virendersehwag . U r the gentlest coolest & bravest of sportsmen I have ever come across. Love & health to u
